medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent left-ankle painful rash with low-grade fever.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 months prior to presentation with a poorly defined painful erythematous patch over the left ankle, associated with leukocytosis. After treatment with cefazolin, the patient showed partial improvement. He experienced multiple discrete episodes with noncontiguous rashes affecting various body parts, resolving spontaneously in a few days. A recurrence occurred 2 days before admission with spreading of the rash and fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, depression, and previous morbid obesity treated with bariatric surgery.
medical_history.social_history: Avid traveler with extensive travel history including China, India, South Asia, Canada, Brazil, and a specific visit to Hong Kong 5 months prior; former sushi chef who frequently consumes raw seafood; lives in Missouri and volunteers with refugees from developing countries receiving treatment for tuberculosis.
